required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Auriculotherapy as a Coping Strategy in Professional Nursing
clinical_study.official_title: Applicability of Auriculotherapy as a Strategy for Stress and Coping in Nursing Professionals

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized clinical trial aimed at evaluating the auriculotherapy as coping strategies in 75 nursing professionals in a University Hospital.

detailed_description.textblock: There is consensus that psychological and social factors can lead to physical health problems of individuals and coping strategies in stressful situations may be crucial for the mental, physical and social development of people. Taking care of professionals who provide health services is a key strategy, since good results depend on the service, especially in work teams healthy and, therefore, able to promote the humanization of service.

primary_outcome.measure: Coping Strategy: Domain Social Support(After 60 Days)
primary_outcome.description: Scale information: Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory with 66 items. The scale is constructed by 8 different "domains": confrontation, distancing, self-control, social support, acceptance of responsibility, escape avoidance, problem solving and positive reappraisal.The questions are scored by Likert scale: 0 (not used this strategy); 1 (used somewhat); 2 (used enough) and 3(used in large quantities) to the 66 items (Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory). It performed a summation of items and defined the scores: 0-4 points (not use this strategy), 5-9 (use this strategy a bit), 10-14 ( use this strategy quite) 14-18 (use strategy plenty).

The questions are scored by Likert scale: 0 (not used this strategy); 1 (used somewhat); 2 (used enough) and 3(used in large quantities) to the 66 items (Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory). It performed a summation of items and defined the scores: 0-4 points (not use this strategy), 5-9 (use this strategy a bit), 10-14 ( use this strategy quite) 14-18 (use strategy plenty).

Scale information: Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory with 66 items. The scale is constructed by 8 different "domains": confrontation, distancing, self-control, social support, acceptance of responsibility, escape avoidance, problem solving and positive reappraisal.The questions are scored by Likert scale: 0 (not used this strategy); 1 (used somewhat); 2 (used enough) and 3(used in large quantities) to the 66 items (Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory). It performed a summation of items and defined the scores: 0-4 points (not use this strategy), 5-9 (use this strategy a bit), 10-14 ( use this strategy quite) 14-18 (use strategy plenty).

secondary_outcome.description: Scale information: Stress Symptoms List (LSS)with 60 items (better outcome)Low score: 12/29 points; Medium score: 30/60 points; High score: 61/120 points; Very high score (worse outcome): >120 points.

arm_group.description: Control Group didn't receive any treatment and was evaluated at the same time and the same way of interventions group
The investigators used 3 points, Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with semi-permanent needles of 1.8 mm, 1 time per week for 8 sessions.
The investigators used the three points Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with mustard seeds, 1 time per week for 8 sessions.

intervention.description: The chinese auriculotherapy is a intervention used by Chinese Traditional Medicine in order to balance the body energy and to treat several kind of diseases using semi-permanent needles in specific points of the auricular pavilion.
We used the three points Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with mustard seeds, 1 time per week for 8 sessions.The subjects were instructed to stimulate the points three times a day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Average and high score by the List of Stress Symptoms
- Voluntary participation in the study
- Availability of time for submission to the sessions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Medical license or vacation during the period
- Low score of stress

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment was conducted between January and September 2011 at University Hospital. Study participants were professionals from different sectors of the hospital after the invitation and 109 people answered the Stress Symptoms List. Obeying the exclusion criteria, 75 subjects were enrolled and randomized into three groups.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 109 subjects, 4 were eliminated for having a low level of stress and three for not belonging to nursing staff.

group.title: Auriculotherapy by Needles
group.description: The investigators used 3 points, Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with semi-permanent needles of 1.8 mm, 1 time per week for 8 sessions. auriculotherapy by needles : The chinese auriculotherapy is a intervention used by Chinese Traditional Medicine in order to balance the body energy and to treat several kind of diseases using semi-permanent needles in specific points of the auricular pavilion.

group.title: Auriculotherapy by Seeds
group.description: The investigators used the three points Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with mustard seeds, 1 time per week for 8 sessions. auriculotherapy by seeds : We used the three points Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with mustard seeds, 1 time per week for 8 sessions.The subjects were instructed to stimulate the points three times a day.

outcome.title: Stress Scale
outcome.description: Scale information: Stress Symptoms List (LSS)with 60 items (better outcome)Low score: 12/29 points; Medium score: 30/60 points; High score: 61/120 points; Very high score (worse outcome): >120 points.
outcome.population: Of the 109 subjects, four were eliminated for having a low level of stress and three for not belonging to nursing staff;seven didn’t appear in the first session. Some lost sessions and were also excluded. One abandoned the treatment because of the side effects, one didn’t complete the questionnaire, seven went on vacation or sick leave(2).

analysis.groups_desc: The main objective was to compare the difference among the control group, seeds and needles and to recognize significant outcomes of auriculotherapy by seeds or needles.
analysis.p_value_desc: It was verified the normality of data distribution and the homogeneity of variance.

measure.title: Coping Strategy: Domain Social Support(After 60 Days)
measure.description: Scale information: Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory with 66 items. The scale is constructed by 8 different "domains": confrontation, distancing, self-control, social support, acceptance of responsibility, escape avoidance, problem solving and positive reappraisal.The questions are scored by Likert scale: 0 (not used this strategy); 1 (used somewhat); 2 (used enough) and 3(used in large quantities) to the 66 items (Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory). It performed a summation of items and defined the scores: 0-4 points (not use this strategy), 5-9 (use this strategy a bit), 10-14 ( use this strategy quite) 14-18 (use strategy plenty).
measure.population: Of the 109 subjects, four were eliminated for having a low level of stress and three for not belonging to nursing staff;seven didn’t appear in the first session. Some lost sessions and were also excluded. One abandoned the treatment because of the side effects, one didn’t complete the questionnaire, seven went on vacation or sick leave(2).

analysis.groups_desc: It was carried out the analysis of variance (ANOVA) among the groups in the 3rd assessment (after 60 days) and at the follow up (after 75 days). The main objective was to compare the difference among the control group, seeds and needles and to recognize significant outcomes of auriculotherapy by seeds or needles.
analysis.p_value_desc: It was verified the normality of data distribution and the homogeneity of variance.
analysis.method_desc: This result was only to the domain Social Support.

outcome.title: Coping Strategy: Distancing Domain
outcome.description: The questions are scored by Likert scale: 0 (not used this strategy); 1 (used somewhat); 2 (used enough) and 3(used in large quantities) to the 66 items (Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory). It performed a summation of items and defined the scores: 0-4 points (not use this strategy), 5-9 (use this strategy a bit), 10-14 ( use this strategy quite) 14-18 (use strategy plenty).

group.title: Auriculotherapy by Needles
group.description: The investigators used 3 points, Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with semi-permanent needles of 1.8 mm, 1 time per week for 8 sessions. auriculotherapy by needles : The chinese auriculotherapy is a intervention used by Chinese Traditional Medicine in order to balance the body energy and to treat several kind of diseases using semi-permanent needles in specific points of the auricular pavilion.

group.description: The investigators used the three points Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with mustard seeds, 1 time per week for 8 sessions. auriculotherapy by seeds : We used the three points Shenmen, Kidney, and Brain Stem with mustard seeds, 1 time per week for 8 sessions.The subjects were instructed to stimulate the points three times a day.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Control Group didn't receive any treatment and was evaluated at the same time and the same way of interventions group

measure.title: Coping Strategy: Distancing Domain
measure.description: The questions are scored by Likert scale: 0 (not used this strategy); 1 (used somewhat); 2 (used enough) and 3(used in large quantities) to the 66 items (Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory). It performed a summation of items and defined the scores: 0-4 points (not use this strategy), 5-9 (use this strategy a bit), 10-14 ( use this strategy quite) 14-18 (use strategy plenty).

analysis.groups_desc: It was carried out the analysis of variance (ANOVA) among the groups at the follow up (after 75 days). The main objective was to compare the difference among the control group, seeds and needles and to recognize significant outcomes of auriculotherapy by seeds or needles.
analysis.p_value_desc: It was verified the normality of data distribution and the homogeneity of variance.

analysis.method_desc: It was carried out the analysis of variance (ANOVA) among the groups at the follow up and then it was used the post hoc test.

outcome.title: Coping Strategy: Social Support Domain
outcome.description: Scale information: Folkman and Lazarus Coping Strategy Inventory with 66 items. It performed a summation of items and defined the scores: 0-4 points (not use this strategy), 5-9 (use this strategy a bit), 10-14 ( use this strategy quite) 14-18 (use strategy plenty).

reported_events.desc: The main symptoms or adverse events were: Nightmares; Complaints of anxiety and unrest; Anxiety for food; Itching and redness in the auricular points.
